New Records: Luka Modric became the oldest scorer in European Championship history with the goal at 38 years, 289 days
Key Match Events: Luka Modric scored a goal for Croatia in the 55th minute, but Mattia Zaccagni equalized for Italy in the 98th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Italy had been rocked with defeat by Spain, which could have been more emphatic than the 1-0 scoreline, yet if there was some solace for Luciano Spalletti's side heading into Monday's match, it was that Croatia had been even less impressive in the event
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Modric described the loss as cruel and hard to describe how he felt. Mattia Zaccagni expressed immense satisfaction and excitement
Miscellaneous Highlights: The result left Italy second in Group B on four points, with Croatia third but now playing an anxious waiting game to see whether two points will be enough to take them through to the knockout stage as one of the best four third-placed sides
Others: The match was played at Red Bull Arena in Leipzig, Germany, with a line of ITA -0.5 and an Over/Under of 2.5. The attendance was 38,322
